message.content: {"facts":["A virtual machine (VM) is a software-based emulation of a physical computer that runs an entire operating system and applications independently of the host system.[1][2][3][4]","VMs rely on virtualization technology, which uses a hypervisor to allocate physical hardware resources (CPU, memory, storage, network) to multiple virtual environments on a single physical host.[2][4]","Key components of a VM include virtual CPU (vCPU), virtual RAM, virtual hard disk (e.g., .vmdk, .vdi files), virtual network interface card (vNIC), and optionally virtual GPU, USB controllers, sound cards, and BIOS/UEFI emulation.[1]","The hypervisor manages resource distribution and isolation between VMs and the host, ensuring each VM operates independently and securely.[1][2][5]","VMs enable running multiple operating systems simultaneously on one physical machine, such as Windows, Linux, or MacOS guests on a single host.[2][3]","Virtual machines provide isolation, meaning each VM is sandboxed from others, enhancing security and stability.[5]","VMs offer portability, allowing virtual machine images to be transferred and run across different hardware platforms or cloud environments.[5]","Resource optimization is a major benefit, as VMs share hardware resources efficiently, reducing the need for additional physical servers.[5]","Common uses of VMs include software development and testing, running legacy applications, server consolidation, cloud computing infrastructure, and remote desktop environments.[1][3][4]","VMs are foundational to cloud computing, enabling scalable, flexible, and cost-effective IT infrastructure.[4]","There are different types of virtual machines: system VMs that emulate entire hardware platforms, and process VMs that run a single program or process (e.g., Java Virtual Machine).[1][2]","Virtual machines can be categorized by their deployment environment: on-premises VMs, cloud-based VMs, and hybrid deployments.[4]","The global virtual machine market was valued at approximately USD 11.11 billion in 2024 and is projected to grow to USD 12.73 billion in 2025, with a long-term CAGR of about 14.71% through 2034.[4]","Integration of AI technologies into VM management and orchestration is rapidly increasing, with the global AI market expected to reach USD 826.70 billion by 2030.[4]","Multi-tenancy is a core feature of VMs in cloud computing, allowing multiple users to share the same physical server resources securely.[5]"],"statistics":[{"value":"USD 11.11 billion","context":"Global virtual CAGR","context":"Expected compound annual growth rate of AI market from 2025 to 2030"}],"key_points":["A virtual machine is a fully isolated software computer that runs on physical hardware via a
